thread.title: New grapes from Old World draw growers, consumers

author: Carey Sweet
title: New grapes from Old World draw growers, consumers
text:
Photo: Dan Evans 8575802|article-6485376|7 8575802|article-6485376|1 email_share_embed|photo-8575802|article-6485376|1 8575802|article-6485376|2 8575802|article-6485376|3 8575802|article-6485376|4 8575802|article-6485376|5 google_share_embed|photo-8575802|article-6485376|6 Kerner grapes grow in a vineyard in Lodi. Kerner grapes grow in a vineyard in Lodi.
Some people simply see grapes as they look around Ron Silva’s ranch. And indeed, there are lots and lots of grapes at his 350-acre Silvaspoons Vineyards in the delta’s Lodi appellation. Kerner grapes grow in a vineyard in Lodi. Kerner grapes grow in a vineyard in Lodi.
Some people simply see grapes as they look around Ron Silva’s ranch. And indeed, there are lots and lots of grapes at his 350-acre Silvaspoons Vineyards in the delta’s Lodi appellation.
